(64)48th Conclusions,Minute 7), the Minister of State for Education and Science madein a speech at West Bromwicli on 24th September,(Signed) BURKE trend cabinet Office, S, v7,1.25th September, 1964, SCHOOL BUILDING SURVEYIt has always been the intention of successive EducationMinisters that the results of the Survey should be published ina suitable form. The assessment of the Survey material has proved to be more complicated than had been foreseen, butthere is no question of postponing publication when it is ready.Meanwhile in the light of the facts already know/n, the conservatives have doubled the annual rate of school replacementand improvements for the years 1965/67, despite the heavy pressure of rising numbers in the schools and the many other claims on educational building. Educational building workstarted in Great Britain will have increased from just over 100 million in 1959/60 to about 220 million in 1965/66.Within this total, major school building projects will have risen from 44.5 million to 84 million. These figures are not just a promise - the projects have been approved,and Local Education Authorities notified.24th September. 1964
